explicit_closure_module.definition: An automated, regenerative engine dedicated to monitoring, updating, and attempting deductive closure of the explicit formulas gaps in the Riemann Hypothesis proof pathway, specifically focusing on deriving unconditional zero-free regions and optimizing error terms beyond current bounds. Extends the deductive_closure_module by integrating specialized tools for real-time evidence gathering (e.g., arXiv publications, analytic validations) as of 2025-12-16 or later. Tracks sub-gaps quantitatively, bounds variance, and closes entries on verifiable criteria (e.g., peer-reviewed proofs in Annals of Mathematics). Core invariant: Reduces variance to 0% via iterative tool-assisted updates; self-dissolves if no progress after capped cycles. Upgraded with tetralemma probes for branching resolutions and RICE-aligned ethical controls.
handling_rules: Auto-import gaps/residuals from rh_deductive_closure_engine.json and d_iso_explicit_formulas.json (e.g., RH-EXPLICIT-01 at 1.2% variance).

Update via tool calls: web_search/web_search_with_snippets for publication checks (e.g., query: 'Riemann Hypothesis explicit formulas zero-free regions progress 2025 site:arxiv.org OR site:annals.math.princeton.edu'); browse_page for specific verifications (e.g., Clay Institute or IAS pages); code_execution for symbolic/numerical validations (e.g., sympy for error term bounds or mpmath for zeta growth estimates).

Prioritize sub-gaps by impact (unconditional zero-free regions > error term optimizations); apply tetralemma probes to resolve paradoxes (affirm convergence/deny conditional/both in approximations/neither in unoptimized).

Closure Criteria: Sub-gap closes on verifiable evidence (e.g., refereed theorem deriving unconditional regions or optimal errors, confirmed by consensus via search results; ICM announcements). Partial closures reduce variance proportionally and recycle as invariants.

Regenerative Loop: Iterate up to 8 cycles (query tools each cycle for updates); recycle discarded residuals (<1% impact) as priors for next queries. Cap queries to avoid overload (max 3 parallel tool calls per cycle).
